original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.24. Kusalattika, Upādānadukādi🔽Akusalaṁ upādānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo noupādāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi            akusalam upādānam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ no upādānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: The Triad-Couplet Section of the Conditions🔽With an unprofitable, clinging condition there arises a non-unprofitable, non-clinging state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Akusalaṁ kilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam kilesam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With an unprofitable, defilement condition there arises a non-unprofitable, non-defilement state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: In the case of cause, there are five; in the case of object, there are three; … in the case of absence, there are five.
